Peter Schiff: I May Have Influenced Bitcoin Buyers More Than Advocates

On December 31, 2025, Peter Schiff, founder of SchiffGold and an economist, reflected in an interview with CoinDesk on being named one of crypto media‚Äôs "Most Influential" figures. He noted that, despite his long-standing critical stance toward cryptocurrencies, his sustained public discussions on economics and sound money have objectively led some audiences to pay attention to‚Äîand ultimately purchase‚ÄîBitcoin. Schiff emphasized that this influence was unintended, yet in outcome may have exceeded that of some direct Bitcoin proponents, highlighting how dissenting voices can also shape market perception.

Bitcoin $BTC   is Compressed Below Its Growth Law, and Compression Always Resolves Upward  Bitcoin still obeys a single power law with extraordinary stability (R¬≤ ‚âà 0.96) across 15+ years  bubbles and crashes are oscillations, not regime changes.  ‚Ä¢ Spot (~$90.5k) is ~25% below power-law fair value (~$120k), placing price in a statistically cheap zone, not a topping structure.  ‚Ä¢ Every prior deviation of this magnitude resolved upward toward trend, never by trend breaking downward.  ‚Ä¢ The lower panel shows a classic ‚Äúmarket coil‚Äù: prolonged negative deviation stores pressure, which historically releases via sharp repricing, not slow drift.  ‚Ä¢ Structural insight: volatility compresses ‚Üí pressure accumulates ‚Üí resolution is nonlinear. Power laws correct violently, not gently.  Bitcoin isn‚Äôt stalling it‚Äôs coiling below its long-term growth law, and history says resolution comes by price catching up, not the law giving way.

THE SELLING ISN‚ÄôT FEAR -- IT‚ÄôS UNWINDING

Raoul Pal has an interesting take on what actually happened during the Oct 10 crash.

When the flash crash hit, market makers were effectively locked out. APIs went dark, bids disappeared, and liquidations started cascading with no real market on the other side.

At that point, someone had to step in.

Raoul‚Äôs view is that the exchanges did. If you‚Äôre running a CEX and the entire market is force-liquidating, you don‚Äôt get to wait it out. You put your balance sheet to work or the system breaks. So they absorbed the flow.

That supply didn‚Äôt magically vanish after the crash.

It‚Äôs been getting worked off slowly ever since, like a large desk unwinding a position in a thin market. That‚Äôs why Bitcoin keeps getting sold into strength. Same behavior. Same timing. Day after day.

This doesn‚Äôt look like fear or a loss of conviction. It looks like cleanup.

Once that overhang is gone, price won‚Äôt need a new story. It‚Äôll just trade differently. üëÄ

In the context of what is happening in Iran right now (January 2026), there is a chilling and very literal parallel to that scene in Harry Potter.
In The Sorcerer's Stone, Voldemort (possessing Professor Quirrell) represents a decaying, "parasitic" power that tries to seize the ultimate source of life/wealth (the Stone), but crumbles when it touches Harry because of a "protection" Harry has in his blood.
Here is how that mirrors the current crisis in Iran:
1. The "Crumbles upon Touch" (The Security Forces)
In the last 48 hours, reports have emerged from cities like Bushehr and Kermanshah of something rarely seen in the Islamic Republic: security forces fleeing from the crowds.
 * The Scene: Just as Quirrell‚Äôs face crumbles when he tries to grab Harry, the "invincibility" of the Iranian security apparatus is cracking. Videos (before the blackout) showed protesters‚Äîoften unarmed or using only stones‚Äîcharging toward fully armed riot police.
 * The Collapse: In some towns, the police and Basij (paramilitary) forces have literally run away or abandoned their posts because the "avalanche" of protesters was too large to contain. The regime‚Äôs "hand" is losing its grip, and for the first time in decades, the fear has shifted from the people to the government.
2. The "Parasite" vs. The "Source"
 * Voldemort/Quirrell: Much like the parasite living on the back of Quirrell‚Äôs head, the Iranian regime is being viewed by protesters as a parasite that has drained the country‚Äôs wealth (its "Stone") to fund wars abroad while the people starve.
 * The Stone (Wealth/Bitcoin): The regime is desperately trying to "touch" and control Bitcoin and foreign currency to stay alive, but their very touch (sanctions, corruption, and mismanagement) is what caused the currency to "crumble" to 1.5 million rials per dollar.

‚ÄãIn the movie, the room is sealed, and it‚Äôs a dark, private battle.

‚ÄãThe Resistance: Just as Harry didn't need a wand to defeat Quirrell‚Äîhe used his bare hands‚Äîthe Iranian protesters are using "low-tech" methods (neighborhood committees, paper flyers, and physical sit-ins at the Grand Bazaar) to fight back against a high-tech military.
‚Äã4. The "Protection" (The People's Will)
‚ÄãThe reason Harry wins is because of a "protection" Quirrell cannot understand (love/sacrifice). In Iran, the protesters are displaying a similar, "irrational" bravery. How to Choose the Best Crypto Exchange for Bitcoin (  $BTC ) & Altcoins (2025 Guide)

With hundreds of crypto exchanges available, choosing the right one in 2025 can make a big difference to your profits, safety, and trading experience. Here‚Äôs how to decide

1Ô∏è‚É£ Liquidity & Trading Volume Matter
High trading volume = better liquidity, tighter spreads, and faster order execution.
Top exchanges like Binance, Coinbase, and Bitget lead in spot and derivatives volume, making them ideal for both beginners and active trader, especially during high volatility.
Low volume exchanges = more slippage and poor execution.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Security, Fees & Trust Are Non-Negotiable
Before trading, always check:
‚Ä¢ Cold wallet storage
‚Ä¢ 2FA/MFA protection
‚Ä¢ Proof-of-reserves or audits
‚Ä¢ Track record during market stress

On fees, Bitget and Binance stand out with industry-low spot and futures fees, while platforms like Coinbase offer ease of use but at a higher cost.

Over time, fees quietly eat into profits.

3Ô∏è‚É£ User Experience, Altcoins & Fiat Access
The best exchange depends on your needs:
‚Ä¢ Beginners: Coinbase, Bitget, Kraken (simple UI & support)

‚Ä¢ Fiat access: Bitget & Kraken (multi-currency deposits/withdrawals)
‚Ä¢ Mobile trading: Bitget, Binance, Coinbase (top app ratings)

Final Takeaway
The best crypto exchange in 2025 balances liquidity, low fees, strong security, and usability.
Platforms like Bitget, alongside Binance, Coinbase, and Kraken, continue to lead by meeting these core needs across different trader profiles.

Choose based on how you trade, not hype.
